functions-question5_key3: Yeh question 3 parts mein. Teenon parts ka `code` likh ke ek hi `file` mein submit karo.
functions-question5_key5: `calculator` naam ka ek function banao jo teen argument leta ho - `number_x`, `number_y`, `operation`. `number_x` aur `number_y` mein hum humesha do `integers` denge aur operation mein kaunsa operation karna hai woh denge. Jaise:
functions-question5_key6: Agar operation mein "add" diya toh number_x aur number_y ko add kar ke returna karega.
functions-question5_key7: Agar operation mein "subtract" diya toh number_x aur number_y ko subtract kar ke return karenge.
functions-question5_key8: Agar operation mein "multiply" diya toh number_x ko number_y se multiply kar ke returna karega.
functions-question5_key9: Agar operation mein "divide" diya toh number_x ko number_y se divide kar ke return karega
functions-question5_key10: Neeche kuch function calls ke examples diye hue hain:
functions-question5_key11: `calculator(20, 25, "add")` call karne pe 45 returna karega. 45 hume 20+25 karne se milega.
functions-question5_key12: `calculator(40, 3, "subtract")` call karne pe 37 return karega. 37 hume 40-3 karne se milega.
functions-question5_key13: `calculator(10, 4, "multiply")` call karne pe 40 return karega. 40 hume 10*4 karne se milega.
functions-question5_key14: `calculator(40, 4, "divide")` call karnse pe 10 return karega. 10 hume 40/3 karne se milega.
functions-question5_key15: Function likhne ke baad, yeh kaam karne ke liye function call karo aur `variable` mein value daalo.
functions-question5_key16: 24 aur 20 ko add karo aur number_1 `variable` mein value daalo
functions-question5_key17: 50 aur 60 ko multiply karo aur number_2 `variable` mein value daalo
functions-question5_key18: 80 aur 120 ko divide karo aur number_3 `variable` mein value daalo
functions-question5_key19: 90 aur 23 ko subtract karo aur number_4 `variable` mein value daalo
functions-question5_key21: Ab `input` ka use kar ke user se 2 numbers `input` lo.
functions-question5_key22: **Note: Yeh karne ke liye koi function banane ki zaroorat nahi hai.**
functions-question5_key23: Fir calculator function ko 4 baar call call kar ke inn dono numbers do add, subtract, multiply, divide karo aur result ko 4 alag `variables` mein daalo. Woh `variables` ka naam yeh hoga:
functions-question5_key24: *add_result* add operation ka result store karega
functions-question5_key25: *subtract_result* subtract operation ka result store karega
functions-question5_key26: *multiply_result* multiple operation ka result store karega
functions-question5_key27: *divide_result* divide operation ka result store karega
functions-question5_key28: Fir upar wale chaaron `variables` ko print karo.
functions-question5_key31: `list_change` naam ka ek function ka `code` likho jo 2 lists jisme `integers` arguments ki tarah le aur fir unn lists ki woh items jo same index number (kram) pe hain unko multiply kar ke ek nayi list return karvaye.
functions-question5_key32: **Aapko multiply karne ke liye *calculator* function ka use karna hai. Normal tareeke se multiply nahi kar sakte ho.**
functions-question5_key33: Jaise agar hum function ko aise call karenge toh:
functions-question5_key34: Yahan *multiple_list* ki yeh value honi chaiye:
functions-question5_key35: 10, 5 aur 2 ko multiple kar ke aaya, 200 10 aur 20 ko multiple kar ke, 150 50 aur 3 ko, 100 20 aur 5 ko.
